page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Farming is the chief industry found in this block. The ground is mostly low lying and most suitable for dairy and beef farming. Their are about 22 farms within the area. In the 3 westerly squares the land is poorly drained and marshy. The old railway line cuts through these. One of the largest farms is Plas Bennett which lies close to Mill Farm. Two of the more interesting farm names are Pwll y Chwiaid Mawr (Pool of the big ducks). Each Thursday and Friday many farmers attend the livestock auction at Ruthin where they can sell their animals.
